answerText: In The First Circle [or V kruge pervom][10] This Russian author described a bunch of prisoners in far worse shape than those in The First Circle in his novel One Day in the Life of Ivan Denisovich.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Penn | 17 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This novel begins with Volodin calling the American embassy under an NKVD wiretap, which eventually leads to his arrest. For 10 points each: [10] Name this novel set during December 24 to 28, 1949 in an "Institute," whose main characters include Nerzhin, Rubin, and other prisoners of relatively high status, such as technicians and scientists
